episode_summary: This episode features facts about the maximum size of a PDF file, a 17th-century law requiring burial in wool, restrictions on women visiting museums in 1914, and innovative recycling of cow dung into furniture.

facts.fact: The maximum PDF file you can send is bigger than Belgium.
During the 17th century, when you died, your relatives were legally forced to bury you wearing wool, whether you liked it or not.
In 1914, women were only allowed to visit the Natural History Museum if a man agreed to sign a note promising that they would behave themselves.
A designer from Indonesia who recycles cow dung has found a way to make stools from stools.
